original: @286b * // 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas mdzad pa'i man ngag zab mo bzhugs /
analyzed: @286b * // 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas mdzad pa'i man ngag zab mo bzhugs /
translated: The profound instructions composed by Ārya Nāgārjuna are present.

original: # // srid pa gsum gyi bla ma la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽'phags pa klu sgrub zhal snga nas //
analyzed: # // srid pa gsum gyi bla ma la phyag 'tshal lo // 'phags pa klu sgrub zhal snga nas //
translated: Homage to the guru of the three existences.🔽The root treasury

original: bkod par gyur pa rtsa ba'i mdzod //
analyzed: bkod par gyur pa rtsa ba'i mdzod //
translated: composed by Ārya Nāgārjuna

original: sems can kun la rjes brtse bas //
analyzed: sems can kun la rjes brtse bas //
translated: out of compassion for all sentient beings

original: bdag gis rab tu brjod par bya //
analyzed: bdag gis rab tu brjod par bya //
translated: I will fully explain.

original: ka na ka panytsanggi blangs nas aa lam bu sha dang / chang gi sa bon dang / sge'u gsher dang / pi bi ling gi sa bon dang / 'di rnams kanydzi ka dang btags nas brisha na la byugs na /
analyzed: ka na ka panytsanggi blangs nas aa lam bu sha dang / chang gi sa bon dang / sge'u gsher dang / pi bi ling gi sa bon dang / 'di rnams kanydzi ka dang btags nas brisha na la byugs na /
translated: Taking kanakapañcāṅga, alakabusha, barley seed, sugarcane juice, and bibilinga seed, mix these with kanyakā, and apply to the penis.

original: ku randa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ku randa sel bar byed do //
translated: It will remove kuranda.

original: ma he'i mar sar dang nas kyi phye dang / n'a ga ba la dang / shu dag dang / aa ti ba l'a dang / @287a * //
analyzed: ma he'i mar sar dang nas kyi phye dang / n'a ga ba la dang / shu dag dang / aa ti ba l'a dang / @287a * //
translated: Buffalo ghee, barley flour, nāgabala, śigru, atibala,

original: ba lnga dang / 'di dag thams cad gcig tu byas nas nyed par byas na sbom por byed pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: ba lnga dang / 'di dag thams cad gcig tu byas nas nyed par byas na sbom por byed pa'i mchog go //
translated: and all of these together, when applied as an ointment, is the best for making it thick.

original: gtun shing lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtun shing lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: It will become like a pestle.

original: mar sar dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / ba l'a dang / n'a ga ba l'a rnams kyis nu ma mchog tu mnyes na de yis bum pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar sar dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / ba l'a dang / n'a ga ba l'a rnams kyis nu ma mchog tu mnyes na de yis bum pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Ghee, sugar, long pepper, cardamom, and nutmeg, if used to massage the breasts, will make them like pots.

original: na ma: sa ba r'a nam ha ri dra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: na ma: sa ba r'a nam ha ri dra sv'a h'a /
translated: Namaḥ sarva-nāthāya hari-dhra-svāhā.

original: so rtsi la lan bdun bsngags pa byas nas gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so rtsi la lan bdun bsngags pa byas nas gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives to someone a tooth stick that has been enchanted seven times, that person will become enthralled.

original: tshangs ma dang / shu dag dang / b'a ma dang / pi pi ling dang / sbrang rtsi dang / rgyam tsha dang / sing ldeng rnams mtshan mo bdun gyi nye bar sbyor bas ngag mi gsal ba dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs ma dang / shu dag dang / b'a ma dang / pi pi ling dang / sbrang rtsi dang / rgyam tsha dang / sing ldeng rnams mtshan mo bdun gyi nye bar sbyor bas ngag mi gsal ba dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Brahmi, sugar, bamboo, long pepper, honey, rock salt, and acacia, if used for seven nights, will clear up unclear speech.

original: byi dang ga'i snying po srang gcig / aa ru ra srang gcig / ba ru ra srang gcig dang / bu ram srang drug ste 'di dag mnyam pa chu dang bcas pa zos na /
analyzed: byi dang ga'i snying po srang gcig / aa ru ra srang gcig / ba ru ra srang gcig dang / bu ram srang drug ste 'di dag mnyam pa chu dang bcas pa zos na /
translated: One part of the essence of the heart of the Indian valerian, one part of the Indian berberry, one part of the Indian licorice, and six parts of molasses, if eaten with water,

original: rlung nad ma lus pa sel bar the tshom med /
analyzed: rlung nad ma lus pa sel bar the tshom med /
translated: will undoubtedly cure all types of wind disorders.

original: tshangs pa'i dbyug pa dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / pri yang ku dang / n'a ga ge sar rnams /🔽so rtsi dang bcas pa bud med la byin na gzhan gyis dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //🔽skar ma rgyal la myos byed kyi 'bras bu blangs te /🔽skar ma skag la shun pa dang / skar ma me bzhi la 'dab ma dang / skar ma nag pa la me tog dang / skar ma snubs la rtsa ba rnams blangs te /🔽'di rnams phye mar byas nas sbrang dang lhan cig ril bu byas te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyug pa dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / pri yang ku dang / n'a ga ge sar rnams / so rtsi dang bcas pa bud med la byin na gzhan gyis dbang du byed par 'gyur ro // skar ma rgyal la myos byed kyi 'bras bu blangs te / skar ma skag la shun pa dang / skar ma me bzhi la 'dab ma dang / skar ma nag pa la me tog dang / skar ma snubs la rtsa ba rnams blangs te / 'di rnams phye mar byas nas sbrang dang lhan cig ril bu byas te /
translated: The filaments of the lotus, the fruit of the bodhi tree, the fruit of the Indian beech, the fruit of the long pepper, and the filaments of the nutmeg,🔽together with a tooth cleaner, if given to a woman, will bring her under one’s power.🔽Take the fruit of the madana tree under the Puṣya lunar mansion.🔽Take the bark under the Aśvayuj lunar mansion, the leaves under the Bharaṇī lunar mansion, the flowers under the Maghā lunar mansion, and the roots under the Mūla lunar mansion.🔽Make a powder of these and make a pill together with honey.🔽

original: ras kyis bcings (ba sa na tso) nas dril ba rdungs nas phye mar byas te /🔽so rtsi dang mnyam du gang la byin pa de thams cad mod la dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽hr'im ghrum bi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ras kyis bcings (ba sa na tso) nas dril ba rdungs nas phye mar byas te /🔽so rtsi dang mnyam du gang la byin pa de thams cad mod la dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽hr'im ghrum bi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /

original: sngags 'di 'dab ma la bris nas gang la byin pa de'i nyin gcig pa dang / nyin gnyis pa dang / nyin gsum pa dang / rims mi bzad pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sngags 'di 'dab ma la bris nas gang la byin pa de'i nyin gcig pa dang / nyin gnyis pa dang / nyin gsum pa dang / rims mi bzad pa sel bar byed do //
translated: Having written this mantra on a leaf, whoever is given it will be cured of one-day, two-day, three-day, and four-day fevers, and of intermittent fevers.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels.

original: na ma aary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma aary'a ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara,

original: bo dhi satva ya /🔽ma h'a satv'a ya /
analyzed: bo dhi satva ya / ma h'a satv'a ya /
translated: the bodhisattva,🔽the great being,

original: ma h'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /
analyzed: ma h'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /
translated: the great compassionate one.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā.

original: aom ka ri ka ri /
analyzed: aom ka ri ka ri /
translated: Oṃ kari kari

original: bi ka re stam bha ni bi ka re stam bha ni /
analyzed: bi ka re stam bha ni bi ka re stam bha ni /
translated: vikari stambhani vikari stambhani

original: sarba ro ga pra sha ma ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sarba ro ga pra sha ma ni sv'a h'a /
translated: sarvaroga-praśamani svāhā.

original: sngags 'di lan @287b nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te /
analyzed: sngags 'di lan @287b nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te /
translated: Having recited this mantra twenty-one times,

original: kha la byabs shing /
analyzed: kha la byabs shing /
translated: rub it on the mouth,

original: gos la mdud pa byas nas rgyal po'i pho brang du zhugs na rgyal po khros pa rab tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos la mdud pa byas nas rgyal po'i pho brang du zhugs na rgyal po khros pa rab tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and tie it to one's clothes. If one enters the king's palace, the angry king will become very pleased.

original: ba lang gi so dang bya rog gi brun mnyam par btags te /
analyzed: ba lang gi so dang bya rog gi brun mnyam par btags te /
translated: Having mixed together ox teeth and crow dung,

original: gang gi mgo la gtor ba de thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi mgo la gtor ba de thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: whatever one scatters on the head of another, they will all become enthralled.

original: yungs kar dkar po dang / shi ba nirm'a lya /
analyzed: yungs kar dkar po dang / shi ba nirm'a lya /
translated: and the dead Nirnaya.

original: gang gi khyim du bzhag na de skrod par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi khyim du bzhag na de skrod par byed do //
translated: If one places it in the house of someone, it will drive them out.

original: s'a kho ta ka'i rtsa ba dang / ba ru ra'i rtsa ba gcig tu byas nas gang gi khyim du bzhag na de'i khyim du rtag tu 'thab mo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: s'a kho ta ka'i rtsa ba dang / ba ru ra'i rtsa ba gcig tu byas nas gang gi khyim du bzhag na de'i khyim du rtag tu 'thab mo 'byung ngo //
translated: The root of Sakataka and the root of Varuna, having made them into one, if one places it in the house of someone, in that house there will always be quarrels.

original: lga dang / pi pi ling dang / pho ba ris dang / 'jam 'bras dang / yung ba dang / skyer pa dang / rgyam tsha dang / ri'i bilba dang / rgya spos kyi rtsa ba dang / sam khya n'a bhi ste /
analyzed: lga dang / pi pi ling dang / pho ba ris dang / 'jam 'bras dang / yung ba dang / skyer pa dang / rgyam tsha dang / ri'i bilba dang / rgya spos kyi rtsa ba dang / sam khya n'a bhi ste /
translated: Red arsenic, long pepper, ginger, white mustard seed, indigo, bamboo manna, black salt, mountain ebony, eagle wood, and Samkhayanabha.

original: 'di dag thams cad chu la btags te mig sman byas na /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad chu la btags te mig sman byas na /
translated: Having mixed all of these in water and made it into eye ointment,

original: rab rib ma lus pa sel bar byed do //🔽w'a ku dzi k'a bri gang dang / rgyam tsha dang / ra'i 'o ma cha mnyam pa byas nas /
analyzed: rab rib ma lus pa sel bar byed do // w'a ku dzi k'a bri gang dang / rgyam tsha dang / ra'i 'o ma cha mnyam pa byas nas /
translated: it will remove all eye diseases without exception.🔽Vakula, brihati, black salt, and goat's milk, having made them equal parts,

original: ba lang gi chu dang mnyam par sbyar te zangs kyi snod du bzhag nas /
analyzed: ba lang gi chu dang mnyam par sbyar te zangs kyi snod du bzhag nas /
translated: having mixed them with cow's urine in equal parts and placed them in a copper vessel,

original: de lus la dril phyi byas na mdze nad ma lus pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de lus la dril phyi byas na mdze nad ma lus pa sel bar byed do //
translated: If one wraps it around one’s body, it will cure all types of leprosy.

original: lcags kyi phye ma dang / mam s'a kashta dang / de bzhin du skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu dang / khu ba srang bcu dang / khu ba des bsgos nas nyi ma la bzhag ste /
analyzed: lcags kyi phye ma dang / mam s'a kashta dang / de bzhin du skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu dang / khu ba srang bcu dang / khu ba des bsgos nas nyi ma la bzhag ste /
translated: Ten palas of iron filings, ten palas of mango stone, and likewise ten palas of emblic myrobalan fruit and juice, and with that juice, one should place it in the sun.

original: slar yang w'a gu dzi k'i' phye ma zhog gang byas nas dkrugs te /
analyzed: slar yang w'a gu dzi k'i' phye ma zhog gang byas nas dkrugs te /
translated: Again, one should add the filings of vajra flower, and having mixed it,

original: rgas pa'o ma'i bza' ba dang lhan cig zos na zhag bdun gyis mdze nad sel par byed do //
analyzed: rgas pa'o ma'i bza' ba dang lhan cig zos na zhag bdun gyis mdze nad sel par byed do //
translated: if one eats it together with the food of an old woman, it will cure leprosy in seven days.

original: de yang gal te las kyi dbang gis na mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de yang gal te las kyi dbang gis na mi 'grub po //
translated: Moreover, if it is not accomplished due to the power of karma,

original: de bzhin du skyu ru cha bcu dang / byi tang ga cha lnga dang / aa ru ra cha bcu dang / tsi tra ka cha lnga dang / w'a gu dzi cha bdun dang / lcags phye cha brgyad dang / ra mo shag cha dgu dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyu ru cha bcu dang / byi tang ga cha lnga dang / aa ru ra cha bcu dang / tsi tra ka cha lnga dang / w'a gu dzi cha bdun dang / lcags phye cha brgyad dang / ra mo shag cha dgu dang /
translated: ten palas of emblic myrobalan, five palas of bītaṅgī, ten palas of yellow myrobalan, five palas of citraka, seven palas of vajra flower, eight palas of iron filings, nine palas of rāmaśa,

original: til mar bsres pa zla ba gcig gis skra dkar 'joms so //
analyzed: til mar bsres pa zla ba gcig gis skra dkar 'joms so //
translated: mixed with sesame oil, will destroy gray hair in one month.

original: 'di ni byug pa mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byug pa mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the brief application.

original: bye'u khanydza r'i ta'i rus pa dang / sbrul gyi mgrin pa'i bags pa dang / shing gang la sbyin pa'i bdug pa de shing de'i drung du mnyam par dor ro //
analyzed: bye'u khanydza r'i ta'i rus pa dang / sbrul gyi mgrin pa'i bags pa dang / shing gang la sbyin pa'i bdug pa de shing de'i drung du mnyam par dor ro //
translated: The bones of a kṛṣata bird, the skin of a snake’s neck, and the wood of the tree to which the oblation is offered—all of these should be cast into the fire in front of that tree.

original: bye'u khanydza r'i ta'i sha dang sbrang rtsi @288a * //
analyzed: bye'u khanydza r'i ta'i sha dang sbrang rtsi @288a * //
translated: The flesh of a kṛṣata bird and honey

original: lhan cig sbyar te /
analyzed: lhan cig sbyar te /
translated: should be mixed together.

original: bya ba'i dus su skye gnas la byugs te /
analyzed: bya ba'i dus su skye gnas la byugs te /
translated: At the time of action, one should anoint the vagina with this mixture.

original: bud med gang la skyes bu mngon par bsgrod par byed na de dang po bzhin du skyes pa de'i bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med gang la skyes bu mngon par bsgrod par byed na de dang po bzhin du skyes pa de'i bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Whichever woman a man approaches will become pregnant with his child, as if it were her first.

original: dgon pa'i 'ug pa bzung nas de'i mig dang pi pi ling gis byugs te /
analyzed: dgon pa'i 'ug pa bzung nas de'i mig dang pi pi ling gis byugs te /
translated: Having caught a wild owl, one should anoint its eyes with long pepper.

original: de'i rdul lhung bas mig la mig sman byas na /
analyzed: de'i rdul lhung bas mig la mig sman byas na /
translated: By the falling of its dust, one’s eyes will be medicated.

original: de sbas pa de mi mthong ngo //🔽s'a p'i ti ta by'a dha tra ro pannam pra yatstshati /
analyzed: de sbas pa de mi mthong ngo // s'a p'i ti ta by'a dha tra ro pannam pra yatstshati /
translated: One will not see what is hidden.🔽One should offer a roasted partridge.

original: nas kyi phye ma dang / yung ba'i phye ma dang / ba'i chu dang / mar dang / spos dkar dang / shing mngar rnams mnyam par sbyar te /
analyzed: nas kyi phye ma dang / yung ba'i phye ma dang / ba'i chu dang / mar dang / spos dkar dang / shing mngar rnams mnyam par sbyar te /
translated: Having ground barley flour, turmeric, milk, ghee, white sandalwood, and sweet flag into a paste,

original: gdong la dril phyi byas na /
analyzed: gdong la dril phyi byas na /
translated: If one anoints one’s face with it,

original: gdong padma lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdong padma lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: one’s face will become like a lotus.

original: rkang pa dag padma'i 'dab ma lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkang pa dag padma'i 'dab ma lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s feet will become like lotus petals.

original: bud med thams cad rgyal po'i pho brang du mdzes shing sdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med thams cad rgyal po'i pho brang du mdzes shing sdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: All women will become beautiful and attractive in the royal palace.

original: yang shing mngar dang btags te ril bu sbyar nas chu'i bum par bcug na /
analyzed: yang shing mngar dang btags te ril bu sbyar nas chu'i bum par bcug na /
translated: Moreover, if one mixes together sweet flag and emblic myrobalan, makes them into pills, and places them in a water pot,

original: bsil bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsil bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the water will become cool.

original: aom ma h'a ba li ja ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ma h'a ba li ja ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ mahāvalījaya svāhā.

original: gos la yongs su bzlas te bsgos na skal ba bzang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos la yongs su bzlas te bsgos na skal ba bzang por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites this over one’s clothes and puts them on, one will have good fortune.

original: rig pa 'dzin pas spre'u'i mjug ma blangs te sbrang dang btags nas lte ba'i phyogs su byugs na ling ga gyen du 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pas spre'u'i mjug ma blangs te sbrang dang btags nas lte ba'i phyogs su byugs na ling ga gyen du 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
translated: A knowledge-holder should take a rhesus monkey’s tail, mix it with honey, and anoint the area of the navel with it. There is no doubt that the penis will become erect.

original: d'urba dkar po dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / pandi ta ga ra'i rtsa ba dang / srin lag gi khrag rnams mnyam par sbyar te /
analyzed: d'urba dkar po dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / pandi ta ga ra'i rtsa ba dang / srin lag gi khrag rnams mnyam par sbyar te /
translated: White durvā grass, sweet flag, costus root, and the blood of the ring finger should be mixed together.

original: dur khrod kyi thal ba dang 'di dag sbyar bas skyes pa dang bud med dbang du byed do //🔽thang phrom pa dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / kanda ka ri dang / sa t'a ba ri dang / 'di dag cha mnyam par byas nas til mar gyis smin par byas pa'i til mar des /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi thal ba dang 'di dag sbyar bas skyes pa dang bud med dbang du byed do // thang phrom pa dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / kanda ka ri dang / sa t'a ba ri dang / 'di dag cha mnyam par byas nas til mar gyis smin par byas pa'i til mar des /
translated: By combining the ashes of a charnel ground with these, one will enthrall men and women.

original: lingga nyed par byas na sbom par byed pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lingga nyed par byas na sbom par byed pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By making a paste of equal parts of prickly chaff, sweet flag, costus root, kaṇṭakī, and satāvari, and by anointing the penis with the oil in which these have been cooked, one will become the best of the thick.

original: lce'i dri ma dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / nirma la cha mnyam par phye mar byas nas gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lce'i dri ma dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / nirma la cha mnyam par phye mar byas nas gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: By making a paste of equal parts of the dirt under a woman's nails, sweet flag, costus root, and nirvāla, and by giving it to someone, one will enthrall them.

original: aa ga ru dang / gu gul dang / she ba shu shka dang / autpal sngon po dang / bu ram sbyar bas bdug pa byas nas bdag nyid rgyal po'i pho brang du song na mchod pa chen po thob @288b cing btsun mo rnams kyis dri snom par byed do //
analyzed: aa ga ru dang / gu gul dang / she ba shu shka dang / autpal sngon po dang / bu ram sbyar bas bdug pa byas nas bdag nyid rgyal po'i pho brang du song na mchod pa chen po thob @288b cing btsun mo rnams kyis dri snom par byed do //
translated: By burning a mixture of aloeswood, guggul, śevallī, blue lotus, and molasses, and by going to the king's palace, one will obtain great honor and the queens will smell the fragrance.

original: bye'u khanydza r'i ta'i brun blangs te /
analyzed: bye'u khanydza r'i ta'i brun blangs te /
translated: By taking the dung of a kṣaṇḍakṛmī insect,🔽and by anointing the penis with it, one will become the best of the thick.

original: si ri sa'i sa bon byugs pas 'chi ba sel to //
analyzed: si ri sa'i sa bon byugs pas 'chi ba sel to //
translated: By anointing with the seed of the sirisa tree, death is averted.

original: bya rog gi lce dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / pi pi ling dang / 'bras thug po che bdun dang / bdag nyid kyi khu ba sbyar te gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: shu dag dkar po'i rtsa ba dang / gi wang lhan cig btags te de'i thig le byas nas gang la bltas pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: b'a gu dzi ka'i 'bras bu'i phye ma dar ba dang lhan cig btags nas de dril te /
translated: One should mix the powder of the fruit of the bāgāyaka with curd and roll it into balls.

original: dar ba'i zan dang / skyur ba thams cad dang lhan cig zos na gzhang 'brum dang / rkang 'bam dang / 'brum phran dang / mdze dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang dug rnams sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dar ba'i zan dang / skyur ba thams cad dang lhan cig zos na gzhang 'brum dang / rkang 'bam dang / 'brum phran dang / mdze dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang dug rnams sel bar byed do //
translated: If one eats it together with all sour things, it will remove hemorrhoids, elephantiasis, smallpox, leprosy, and the bursting of the uvula.

original: b'a gu dzi ka'i 'bras bu dar ba dang lhan cig btags nas de dril bas mdze thams cad dang / bi tsartsi ka la sogs pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: b'a gu dzi ka'i 'bras bu dar ba dang lhan cig btags nas de dril bas mdze thams cad dang / bi tsartsi ka la sogs pa sel bar byed do //
translated: One should mix the fruit of the bāgāyaka with curd and roll it into balls. It will remove all leprosy, vitsarpi, and so forth.

original: p'a gu dza ga bre gang dang / seng  ldeng zho gang mnyam par byas te /
analyzed: p'a gu dza ga bre gang dang / seng  ldeng zho gang mnyam par byas te /
translated: One should take one prastha of bāgāyaka and one prastha of kṣīraka.

original: chu bre brgyad dang bskol bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu bre brgyad dang bskol bar bya'o //
translated: One should boil it with eight prasthas of water.

original: de ni cha phyed lus pa na btungs te /
analyzed: de ni cha phyed lus pa na btungs te /
translated: When half remains, one should drink it.

original: bya rog gi lce dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / bilba'i 'dab ma dang / gur gum dang / bdag nyid kyi khrag dang mnyam par sbyar bas shing yang dbang du byed do //
analyzed: bya rog gi lce dang / shu dag dang / ru rta dang / bilba'i 'dab ma dang / gur gum dang / bdag nyid kyi khrag dang mnyam par sbyar bas shing yang dbang du byed do //
translated: One should mix it with kākajivika, dry ginger, long pepper, bilva leaves, saffron, and one’s own blood. It will even enthrall trees.

original: aom pi sh'a ts'i r'u be n'a ling+ga ya tsumba ya /
analyzed: aom pi sh'a ts'i r'u be n'a ling+ga ya tsumba ya /
translated: Oṃ piśācī ruru veṇilīṃga ya cumbaya,

original: bha gam sanytse yanya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: bha gam sanytse yanya sv'a h'a /
translated: bhagaṃ sañcayaṃ yān svāhā.

original: sngags kyi tshig 'di chu khyor ba gang la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te nyal ba'i dus su rig ma gang gi ming smos nas btab na /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig 'di chu khyor ba gang la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te nyal ba'i dus su rig ma gang gi ming smos nas btab na /
translated: Having enchanted a handful of water with this mantra twenty-one times, if one sprinkles it on the face of any woman at the time of going to sleep,

original: zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis mi'i dbang po'i btsan mo yin na'ang dbang du 'gyur na gzhan lta ci smos /
analyzed: zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis mi'i dbang po'i btsan mo yin na'ang dbang du 'gyur na gzhan lta ci smos /
translated: even if she is the queen of the king of men, she will be under one's control within twenty-one days, not to mention others.

original: khrag skrod pa'i rtsa ba /
analyzed: khrag skrod pa'i rtsa ba /
translated: The root of blood-expelling

original: karmar ngaga'i rtsa ba dang sihya'i lo ma dang / @289a * //
analyzed: karmar ngaga'i rtsa ba dang sihya'i lo ma dang / @289a * //
translated: The root of karamarda, the leaf of sihyā,

original: 'di dag mnyam par byas rkang pa'i mthil la byugs na sa bon 'ching bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag mnyam par byas rkang pa'i mthil la byugs na sa bon 'ching bar byed do //
translated: If one makes these equal and applies it to the soles of the feet, it will bind the seed.

original: aa ru ra dang / zhu mkhan dang / lung thang gi 'dab ma dang / dha du ra dang / se 'bru'i shun pa dang / sa kha sya nangga pra ma do m'a n'am t'a ye pashti sa si kham ka ro ti /
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / zhu mkhan dang / lung thang gi 'dab ma dang / dha du ra dang / se 'bru'i shun pa dang / sa kha sya nangga pra ma do m'a n'am t'a ye pashti sa si kham ka ro ti /
translated: Arjuna, śūkara, the leaf of lungtang, dhūrtā, the husk of cardamom, and śāka

original: aom ra tsandi ma h'a dand'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ra tsandi ma h'a dand'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ racandimā mahādanḍāya svāhā.

original: sngags 'dis bdun du mngon par bsngags nas gos la sogs par mdud pa byas na bya ba ma lus pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags 'dis bdun du mngon par bsngags nas gos la sogs par mdud pa byas na bya ba ma lus pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: na ma:s'akshi:ka p'a la m'a li th'a h'a /

original: gzhan yang byi la'i khrag blangs nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byi la'i khrag blangs nas /

translated: and having anointed a mango seed with sesame oil,

original: padma'i skud pas sdong bu byas nas dbang phyug gi mdun du dud pa 'chags bar byas te mig la byugs pa tsam gyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma'i skud pas sdong bu byas nas dbang phyug gi mdun du dud pa 'chags bar byas te mig la byugs pa tsam gyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro //

original: aom ci ti he he /
analyzed: aom ci ti he he /
translated: Oṃ citti he he!

original: sngags 'dis chu dkrugs te mig la byugs na the tshom med par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags 'dis chu dkrugs te mig la byugs na the tshom med par grub par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bya rog gi khrag dang / ce spyang gi mkhris pa dang / 'ug pa'i rus pa dang / 'di dag cha mnyam pa'i phye ma zhib mor byas te /

original: mig la byugs na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //

translated: the two salts, namely, saindhava and vida,🔽and shringabera, should be taken in equal parts.🔽The person who consumes the powder of this🔽along with ghee and sugar🔽cures vata disorders.🔽The powder of the three spices, namely, ajaji, ajamoda and maricha,🔽the two salts, namely, saindhava and vida,

original: @290a * // rgyam tsha zi ra rnam gnyis dang // shing kun cha brgyad mnyam par bzung //
analyzed: @290a * // rgyam tsha zi ra rnam gnyis dang // shing kun cha brgyad mnyam par bzung //
translated: and shringabera, should be taken in equal parts.

original: 'di yi phye ma mar sar dang // skye bo gang zhig za byed pa //
analyzed: 'di yi phye ma mar sar dang // skye bo gang zhig za byed pa //
translated: The person who consumes the powder of this🔽along with ghee and sugar

original: rlung gi nad ni sel bar byed //
analyzed: rlung gi nad ni sel bar byed //
translated: cures vata disorders.🔽One pala each of arura, varuna,🔽one pala each of amlavetasa,🔽one pala each of pippali,🔽one pala each of nagara,

original: m'u la ma yastu bu na bhu ba ya: bi ba ti kshi ra na ba pra tya tsurnantcha sya gu do sa ma hi ta ba to dz'i rne ya shashta si na:h'i n'am gonyapi sa dznya ya tonyartsi ta p'i l'am ham sendra kunbha pra bham /🔽m'a so ni bardhi ra sh'u barsha ba ya s'a mu ksho dza r'a by'a dhi bhi:aa ru ra srang gcig / ba ru ra srang gcig / skyu ru ra srang gcig / tsi tra ka srang gsum /

original: lga srang gcig / pi pi ling srang gcig / na le sham srang gcig / n'a ga ge sar gyi phye ma zho bzhi /
analyzed: lga srang gcig / pi pi ling srang gcig / na le sham srang gcig / n'a ga ge sar gyi phye ma zho bzhi /
translated: one pala each of pippali,🔽one pala each of nagara,

original: pho ba ris dkar po zho do //
analyzed: pho ba ris dkar po zho do //
translated: The belly is white sugar.

original: sdig srin rva zho do //
analyzed: sdig srin rva zho do //
translated: The shell of the crab is sugar.

original: dug zho do //
analyzed: dug zho do //
translated: The poison is sugar.

original: 'di dag thams cad phye ma zhib mor byas nas bu ram srang lnga bcu rtsa lnga dang bsres te gang gis zos pa de me stobs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad phye ma zhib mor byas nas bu ram srang lnga bcu rtsa lnga dang bsres te gang gis zos pa de me stobs su 'gyur ro //
translated: All of these should be made into a fine powder, mixed with fifty-five ounces of molasses, and eaten. Whoever does so will have a strong digestive fire.

original: thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will retain what they hear.

original: mdze nad bco brgyad nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdze nad bco brgyad nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The eighteen types of leprosy will be destroyed.

original: thang byed kyi nad dang / glo dang 'bugs dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: thang byed kyi nad dang / glo dang 'bugs dang / de bzhin du /
translated: [It cures] dysentery, tuberculosis, and likewise🔽liver disease, jaundice, boils, wind disorders, snake bites, and louse-borne diseases.

original: mchin nad dang / skya rba ba dang / 'bras dang / rlung nad dang / sbrul dang / srin bu l'u ta dang / dug nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: mchin nad dang / skya rba ba dang / 'bras dang / rlung nad dang / sbrul dang / srin bu l'u ta dang / dug nad sel bar byed do //
translated: It also cures poisons.

original: de bzhin du brtan pa dang g-yo ba 'ang ngo //🔽stobs glang po che dang mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtan pa dang g-yo ba 'ang ngo // stobs glang po che dang mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, [it cures] the fixed and the moving.🔽One's strength becomes equal to that of an elephant.

original: shugs rta lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shugs rta lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: One's speed becomes like that of a horse.

original: zla ba gcig gis mer 'gyur ro ;🔽; rna ba phag lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gcig gis mer 'gyur ro ; ; rna ba phag lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: In one month, one becomes like fire.🔽One's ears become like those of a pig.

original: mig bya rgod lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig bya rgod lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: One's eyes become like those of a vulture.

original: 'di thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of this will be unassailable.

original: 'phags pa rgyal ma zhes bya ba'i ril bu yongs su rdzogs so//
analyzed: 'phags pa rgyal ma zhes bya ba'i ril bu yongs su rdzogs so//
translated: The Noble Dhāraṇī of Jayā is complete.
